events.name: Our First Solr Meetup - Plus a talk on Autosuggest!
events.description:
Hey everyone, our first Solr SG meetup is here! This'll be a great chance to get to meet more people in the search community. Plus, I'll give a talk on a couple of ways to add autosuggest in Solr, the pros & cons of each, and an example of what we did for a recent client in Singapore.  I'm currently still looking for a venue to host this event. If you know anyone that can help out let me know. I'll send an update when a venue is confirmed. 


***UPDATE*** We have a venue now. Thanks! 


Looking forward!
events.location: Amazon Web Services Office, Level 10, 23 Church Street, Singapore

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description:
We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance  


This week we'll be covering Chapter 15 & 16: XMLHttpRequest and Server-Sent Events Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: August Meetup
events.description: Hi folks!  We look forward to having you join us for our August meetup, on the 25th, 7.00pm at Government Digital Services, IDA. We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Anna, Winston or Guo Xiang) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips.  See you on the 25th! Venue: Sandcrawler. 1 Fusionopolis View #08-01 S138577. -------------- 1. "Material Design for Rails" - Sam Hon @kopisam 2.  3. "5 Random Ruby Tips" - Su Sheng Loong  @code_ssl  * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting!  -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com,or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com, or Guo Xiang @tgx_world or tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks:  Venue:
